text: same problem

Hey people,
I am working on migrating our JSON cards to React and I would like to show different content based on users team in the <https://app.HubSpot.com/docs/529308/doc/platform/create-ui-extensions#add-ui-extension-functionality|context>. Is there a way to identify the main team of the user that is looking at a CRM Card? It seems to me that simply all teams are listed without discrimination of if it is primary team or not. I was then also looking into checking out the roles in context, but it does not populate any data for me. Roles in this object is referencing the assigned permission set, correct? If so, what could be a reason for no data even though I have the permission set super user?

Another question: is the `crm::objectProperty` type not existent anymore? :cry: Is there any other way I can add a input form that gets populated by a properties dropdown options? The <https://app.HubSpot.com/docs/529308/doc/platform/ui-extension-components#select-input|Select component> only seems to accept hardcoded values.
Having the same issue
You can use the property list component
This is definitely strange. Would you be able to share your project code?
Assuming it still pops up after enrolling the account to the beta?
Hey Sejal I figured it out. For some reason the portal wasn't enrolling in the beta , so I ended up enrolling the parent account and that seemed to fix it
Are you changing card UID, title?
Btw, If you change card's title, it should not be impacting anything
If you can share your portal ID (here or DM), we can investigate. <@UV23JHEJY> <@U04RDS77QF7> <@U06333EE0DN> <@U05CJMDM467>

Thanks Manuel, we don't yet add primary team to the context, we will consider that.

Let me get back to you on the roles part.
Same issue for me
Hi Manuel! Could you tell me more about your use case? Which properties do you want to populate this by?

Thanks so much for bringing this up!:memo:
Could you give me examples of your use cases for a native Map component?

IRL Service based businesses, think realtors, plumbers, window washers, etc etc.
In all of these cases you have to match a particular object (could be a contact, company, deal etc) to a entity that provides these services (I usually have these setup as custom objects), it's really really tough to tell just with an address which person should be matched with which job, maps would solve this issue.

Another example I have for you, I have several shipment systems built in HubSpot, being able to actively track these packages from the native interface would be absolutely killer.

<@U032JBY6BAR>, Viewrail has installers for particular jobs right? A map would probably help with this matching right?

Ah thank you Carter. So much has changed :sweat_smile: this makes it a lot faster to add, but unfortunately it also removes some functionality. The use case was that we show certain properties that still needs input at certain stages of a deal or lead process. That way we reduce visual clutter and make it very simple what needs to be done and what not. This has been a huge plus of the CRM Cards for us, since there is so much info and our reps often felt a little bit lost in what needs to be done at what point. Nudging reps to certain properties that need work at certain stages (but not always) made them super happy.

While I like the aesthetics of the new module, it is pretty hard to see that the values can be changed, as it is very white and the little dropdown icon drowns slightly in all the competing visuals. If we could colour some fields if empty and take away some fields conditionally that would be awesome.
Yeah I mean you can 100% conditionally show properties on that modules depending on which stage of the deal it's on or whatever
Totally get the UI take, it is a little confusing at first. You could build it from scratch with input components, or just train the sales people.
Forgive my ignorance and newbness, but where do I find the option to show properties conditionally? Do I have to enable something?
Ah I'm talking about using the propertylist component from inside a react card
that will allow you to use JS to define which component are shown when
In the record page editor, there currently isn't an option for dynamic cards
<@U021CFGT73K> might be able to give you more info about how the team is thinking about dynamic cards in the record page customizer
Yea this would be amazing to map their locations relative to jobs quickly and see who is available close to jobs

Oh my god, you mean this one right: <https://app.HubSpot.com/docs/529308/doc/platform/ui-extension-components#property-list|CrmPropertyList>? I am blind, thanks. That is pretty much what `crm::objectProperty` did, it looks like.
just trust us and let us make custom components plz shouldn't have to rely on HubSpot to create them
yep yep, exactly. you're totally good man
And honestly for this map component you could just make it 3 props to start (GeoJSON, Onclick, and apikey) (Obviously this would be confined to mapbox for now)
<@U04N6N424MB> or just open source the component build process and allow us to create pull requests for new components, HubSpot would have the final say for the approval
yeah even better

<@U03FJQPSC0Y>, the issue originally affected our live portal (2686234) but I was also able to replicate it in our sandbox (43776582).
Also, the deployment didn't change anything but a small spelling error.
Thanks, we are investigating this on our end. Will keep you posted.
Honestly thought we could use maps same (or near same) way we could in JSON cards.
